original_solution_mapping.L1: He wants to save $1,000.00 and he has $100.00 left over so he still needs to save 1000-100= $<<1000-100=900.00>>900.00
original_solution_mapping.L2: He wants to save $900.00 over 12 months so that means he needs to save 900/12 = $<<900/12=75.00>>75.00 per month

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3510.
    Returns: the amount Alfred needs to save each month.
    """
    # L1
    total_goal_amount = 1000.00 # Alfred likes to save $1,000.00
    left_over_amount = 100.00 # He has $100.00 left over from last year's holiday
    money_needed_to_save = total_goal_amount - left_over_amount

    # L2
    num_months = 12 # over 12 months
    monthly_saving_needed = money_needed_to_save / num_months

    # FA
    answer = monthly_saving_needed
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He wants to save ${total_goal_amount}.00 and he has ${left_over_amount}.00 left over so he still needs to save {total_goal_amount}-{left_over_amount}= $<<{total_goal_amount}-{left_over_amount}={money_needed_to_save}.00>>{money_needed_to_save}.00

He wants to save ${money_needed_to_save}.00 over {num_months} months so that means he needs to save {money_needed_to_save}/{num_months} = $<<{money_needed_to_save}/{num_months}={monthly_saving_needed}.00>>{monthly_saving_needed}.00 per month

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: He wants to save $1000.00 and he has $100.00 left over so he still needs to save 1000-100= $<<1000-100=900.00>>900.00
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He wants to save $900.00 over 100 months so that means he needs to save 900/100 = $<<900/100=9.00>>9.00 per month

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'left_over_amount' (100.0) was used instead of 'num_months' (12).
